website_summaries.verdict: Engages and challenges kids by combining a tablet app with real-world elements, providing instant feedback on strategy, math, reading and art games.
pros: Cleverly designed, intuitive games that engage kids
Combines electronic device use with tactile visual elements like shapes, letters, paper and pen
Base adjusts to fit different iPad widths
cons: Word game letters are easy to lose
Older kids may lose interest quickly
iPads must be removed from protective cases to fit the base

website_summaries.verdict: Teachers routinely buy these for their own kids, as the kit offers learning-focused games and lessons that grow with a child.
pros: Offers games and coding basics for kids from toddler age and upward
Sets up easily and syncs immediately with iPads
Children can spend hours tackling the different challenges
cons: iPads must be out of their case to fit into the Osmo base
Advertising on Osmo app can be annoying
Coding games and lessons may be too advanced for kids under 6

website_summaries.verdict: This award-winning system brings iPads to life with a variety of hands-on learning activities.
pros: Kids learn math, spelling, visual thinking, problem solving, and drawing in a uniquely fun and practical manner
Varying skill levels are suitable for a wide range of ages and abilities
cons: Exclusively designed for use with an iPad, severely limiting functionality

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible for kids... and makes adults want to try
customer_reviews.text: One of the most ingenious and cleverly designed learning tools I've ever seen. It's very easy to set up, the games are intuitive and build from easy to hard, and the interface is beautiful. The kids want to use it every day and I'm in my 30s and do too! The only semi-negative issue is the stand can't accommodate a case. I understand why this is, but we can't go taking the Otterbox case off and on every time we want to use Osmo. I wish there was a clever solution to this problem.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: WOW! Learning made fun!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a Christmas Gift for my 8 yr old daughter. Wow! What a hit! Finally something we can both agree on. She loves the drawing the best, math is her second favorite, third is the tangram game. The word game is good too but she has dyslexia (which is why we bought this module) and it does create frustration for her. She really loves to interact with the iPad and I must admit, while I am an electronics skeptic for little ones, I have a hard time arguing with her iPad use when she is learning tangibly. I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Osmo is a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received Osmo asa Christmas gift. She has tried playing the games many times with not much luck. The camera doesn’t “see” what she’s doing and the majority of the time we aren’t 100% sure what the game wants us to do. It didn’t come with instructions for each game, so we are left in the dark wondering what to do. Osmo is extremely frustrating and a waste of money! Don’t bother buying this. There are free coding games that are better!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome kit!
customer_reviews.text: This has been awesome for my 8yr old daughter. The games are great learning tools without boring her. Only this kit is necessary...I bought a cheap dry erase board & markers & she can use the "Monster" app as well. She loves seeing her art come to life! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Only ok
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter wanted this soooo badly for Christmas. Have to say she tried to love it ... but it just didn't have enough to interest her. Since then she said "maybe the creative add-on is better". NOPE, not from me! Another chunk of cash for something that MAY entertain her? I don't think so. VERY DISAPPOINTING TO BOTH OF US.
customer_reviews.author: The Gift Lady

customer_reviews.title: Cute but only for very young kids
customer_reviews.text: This is cute, but there is no way a 12 year old plays with this. My son is 7 and it’s too easy for him. He figured out all three games in less than 30 minutes and lost interest.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my kindergartener.
customer_reviews.text: Oh we love osmo!!! Great learning activities but the kids don’t even know realize how much it challenges them. My son who is in kindergarten is obsessed with every single game and it is a new challenge every time.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.I

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this product as much as I thought I would. First, you have to take your iPad out of its case to use it. It’s a hassle and I’m worried my child will drop our iPad every time we use it. Also, the Tangram game keeps popping up with a message to move the pieces a certain direction. We do it and the message still pops up. My 6 year old is so frustrated she won’t play the game. There are other apps or software that is cheaper and more convenient. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: OwO

customer_reviews.title: we still love the game
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his OSMPO Genius kit. We lost a couple of letters for the word game though. The only challenge is that the base does not work well when the iPad is in the case. he always struggles to get tablet out of the protective case to be able to use it with the iPad base , though this is not an issue with the game it makes it hard to use the game without an adult. The effect of this is that he accidentally drop the iPad once when taking it out and it sustained small crack. we still love the game.
customer_reviews.author: Coretta

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design unless you trust a small child to have no case on a tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this is an ipad accessory for children that you cannot use if your ipad has a protective case. My daughter was so disappointed, we purchased this kit and two other games as her "big" Christmas gift, but have to return all three.
customer_reviews.author: emily p jenkins

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful gift!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old grandson was so happy with this gift. He's an outside rough and tumble kid, but couldn't get enough of this device right after he opened it. So far he's only done the shapes and numbers. He really enjoys being stumped and then figuring things out. On the numbers, he soon began subtracting/adding really fast in order get the correct answer by modifying his previous answer instead of starting all over from scratch. It took him about 15 minutes to learn about multiplying the 5s. It works amazingly well with the iPad, and precisely square placement is not necessary. I'd certainly purchase it again!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Brock

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this, don't waste you money. don't trust reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I have an ipad 9.7 Pro, it says that this will fit. Guess what, it does not fit perfectly like how the older ipad sits. This this is almost rendered useless because of the way it sits, it keeps falling down. So frustrated right now. why make and advertise it for the ipad 9.7 pro while it clearly does not fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mastermas619

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Item Grandkid Received for Xmas. All of us Can play
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, Love Osmo. I wish it was a little cheaper so I could gift it to other kids. While my granddaughter does not play with it every day, when she does play with it, she spends a good hour. Her favorite is the Pizza game and the Monster drawing one. We have the Jam Coding and Disney Studios and she not opened or played with them yet. She does play with the primary items of the tiles and the math but has not attacked the spelling one yet. What is neat about Osmo is I don't mind playing with her if she requests and I find it as much fun as she does. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ogburn

customer_reviews.title: A SPECTACULAR gift!!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST Christmas present we bought. Two boys: 6 and 9. There's something for each of them. The only drawback I can think of is if you don't have an (extra) iPad/device. My dad happened to give us one so we didn't have to buy a separate one. This is an amazing and challenging kit! Great for "brainy" kids. Strategy, critical thinking, problem solving and fun are all included. Highly recommend!! (Newton and Tangram games shown in image below.)
customer_reviews.author: Laura J

customer_reviews.title: I thought my kids would love this (7 and 10) but they find it annoying ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought my kids would love this (7 and 10) but they find it annoying that it cannot be used with a case on their iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Platenik

customer_reviews.title: Love the Osmo kit
customer_reviews.text: Love the Osmo kit!!! I have a 4 and 3 year old. My 4 year old could do most of it by himself but did need some help. My 3 year old isn't quite ready for it. They love the shapes it is their favorite part. I plan on ordering more of the kits for his birthday.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Braun

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Got this during the prime deals! I’m so happy I did my 4 year old loves the games. The games are higher level then I thought they would be so he needs more help from me then expected. But he is still very interested. Love the containers the materials come in so easy to store and keep track of them. The quality is good but be careful and don’t let water touch the number and letter blocks it can ruin them. I totally recommend this for your kids even at the regular price it is worth it. My sun picks these games over some other ones he has on his iPad.
customer_reviews.author: Theisel

customer_reviews.title: Sadly - Not So Genius
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately not as compelling a gift for my 8 year old granddaughter as I had hoped. The various components of the Kit were uneven in their appeal. Instead of inviting the child to explore the various presentations, the Genius Kit simply channels the child into familiar and comfortable topics. I think that the concept of the Genius Kit appeals more to the parent (grandparent) than to the children who receive the gift. Too bad! I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: KD Murray, M.D.

customer_reviews.title: Truly Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely LOVES this! It is great for kids to learn how to follow directions, spell, add, all sorts of things. The monster app is amazing (You do not need to buy the extra kit; just use the base and a white board). I can't wait until he puts it away so I can play! Seriously, great toy for kids! Can't wait for more.
customer_reviews.author: Adelle

customer_reviews.title: No case protection when in used -> high probability with kids to break the tablet
customer_reviews.text: Good idea, bad design. This product is meant for kids. Therefore you shouldn’t have to remove the tablet protection. Now the iPad with no casing is prone to be broken. I suggest that you should redesign the base to accommodate the casing. I understand that it can be difficult to make a big slot to accommodate any casing. As a result i suggest to make casings that you will sell and make more money ;-)
customer_reviews.author: DUPUY Alexandre

customer_reviews.title: 6-8 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My 4 year old liked it but needed a good bit of assistance . My 10 year old likes it but gets bored easily - I would bet that 6-8 is the perfect age group
customer_reviews.author: Tori Powell

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!!! So much joy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 yr old son for Christmas. I will admit it took a while to figure out how to work it and setting it up on the iPad took some time with downloading all the apps, but once we figured it out it is so much fun. Even my 7 yr old is playing along. I have an iPad Pro and it works just great. I'm not worried about it falling forward because I have a tempered glass protector, and my son is very careful with the iPad. The joy this is bringing him is so worth the price!!! Thank you thank you thank you Osmo for creating such an awesome, fun learning game.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: iPad can’t have a case.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter’s achy started using this kit last year in an effort to promote more STEM into their curriculum. This was purchased a gift for my 5 year old who is struggling with early reading, letter sounds etc. He immediately started using it. My only complaint is that I have to take his iPad out of it’s protective case to use the stand and mirror clip.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old in hope that it will help her with her reading and math. Already I am highly impressed with her progress and want to play it. I have even recommended it to her teacher
customer_reviews.author: bri

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: We got this on prime deals so the price was unreal, I should have bought one more and saved it for my nephew for Christmas. This is the best toy I think My kids have owned. They play for hours and yes it has electronics but still requires for them to use their brain and imagination and expand on their skills. Must buy this toy. It has no downfalls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my 9 yr old. She was very excited to use it and so was I. It was disappointing to say the least. The sensor area was too small to pick up what she was putting down. We had to readjust the iPad and move it around to pick it up. Even then it doesn’t pick up everything. It was very difficult and frustrating for her to use so she didn’t even care for it after the trying the first couple days. So another item sitting around not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Vannhi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic system!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this system is so beyond what I had expected! It’s easy user friendly experience is simple enough for our 5 year old to navigate it with ease. Both of our girls jump for joy when we ask them to go work on the OSMO. The only drawback as a parent is the small tiles that come with each of the sets- so far we’ve managed to keep them all together. I do have a feeling that down the road a few of them will get lost along the way.
customer_reviews.author: Selenabb

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: You are paying for a plastic stand and a handful of plastic and cardboard pieces. The app isn't worth the entry price, as there are far better learning apps in the Apple Store. In theory, the physical pieces should encourage engagement, but there really isn't much here to keep a child interested. I'm also upset that the price of this dropped $10 after ordering it as a Christmas gift for my nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Derek P.

customer_reviews.title: Mom of 3 approved
customer_reviews.text: We got this half off for amazon prime day and I am so glad we decided to purchase it. My kids love osmo and all the games. It is probably my favorite educational thing that I have bought my kids. We have tried abcmouse and my kids quickly got bored with the site. However, with Osmo my kids are constantly asking to play with it. We are looking forward to getting the pizza add on game.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal. You get a base
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. You get a base, mirror, and five games - three of the games come with pieces and two are online - and two require pen and paper or a white board and markers. The games are super fun and very interactive. My kids are 7 and 9 and they love it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I just opened my kits as I am a kindergarten teacher and with the school year in full gear I was ready to take it out and show my students how to play. There are 2 missing letters in the word package. There is no RED G and no BLUE W. I really don't want to purchase this part separately so I am quite bummed. I hope the seller can help me out with this.
customer_reviews.author: Shari B Grabow

customer_reviews.title: Makes learning so much fun
customer_reviews.text: My daughter LOVES learning and Is no makes it so fun and engaging. If she's got to be on the iPad, this is a way better option than. Watching YouTube. My only complaint is the iPad can't be in a case for this to work. My daughter is 5 and accidents happen. I'd love if Osmo made a compatible case. Despite that, we have already purchased more Osmo games to play with and learn from.
customer_reviews.author: Candace J.

customer_reviews.title: My 4-year-old Loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted an iPad and I wanted him to do more than watch Netflix and YouTube kids, so I found Osmo. We love it! He’s 4 and there’s a Junior version of the games that teach them the ropes. It gets him engaged and he wants to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Venisha Davis

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: We love Osmo. My daughter has dyslexia and hates to work on spelling. This makes it fun and entertaining so I dont even have to argue. We will be buying more osmo games
customer_reviews.author: Tim Denning

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My daughters kindergarten teacher highly recommends osmo and so do I!!! During our homeschooling time osmo has been a huge help!! There are so many Fun and engaging games that offer exceptional learning opportunities for my 6 year old. Best purchase I ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah hart

customer_reviews.title: Very educational and package well and stores well but a full size iPad works better than a mini
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 yo grand son and he loves it as well as I do! Very educational and package well and stores well but a full size iPad works better than a mini, so he uses my iPad Air instead of his mini
customer_reviews.author: Sharice Perkins

customer_reviews.title: So glad we purchased
customer_reviews.text: My daughter received her Osmo genius kit today . She saw this product on you tube and with her selling some of her old items in a yard sale she made enough money to buy it . It’s super easy to install and set up . I took me aprox 10min to download all the apps and activate the Osmo account . My daughter is having a blast playing with it . Way better than having her be in kidstube !
customer_reviews.author: Jackaline Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get kids learning and have fun doing it.
customer_reviews.text: My son is not even close to 5 yet, but I help him do the activities and he observes the screen and points to it, telling me where to place the shapes or letters. He can identify the shapes without the app too. It’s a great fun device for the kids and was so much cheaper than buying at the Apple store.
customer_reviews.author: Shelbi H

customer_reviews.title: Good if the apps work together
customer_reviews.text: My daughter I bought this for enjoys the games. Initially the games wouldn’t work but once we used the main osmo app versus clicking the game’s app we wanted to load it worked more smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This has made learning time so much fun. My kids love all the games. I have a 5yr, 7yr and 9yr. They all love the games. I love the different levels and how it can challenge kids no matter what age they are.
customer_reviews.author: EDWARD L GUYMON JR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our daughters 7th birthday and she was so excited. We set it all up and she's been loving it. I was super happy to see they have a parent app that tracks what they do. We definitely plan to get some of the other attachments.
customer_reviews.author: jenna

customer_reviews.title: Great for number sense and phonics!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome! I use it in my first grade classroom. My students absolutely love the games. It helps them learn number sense and phonics in a fun way. I can see how they do on the games and check their progress.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B Cruse

customer_reviews.title: The jury may still be out but I see that ...
customer_reviews.text: The jury may still be out but I see that one of my grand children plays with this device almost on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Barb the Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Such a GREAT buy!! My soon to be 4 yr old is already doing the Tangrams perfectly and learning letters. So happy to find this! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kori A.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun, younger users may need direction
customer_reviews.text: My kid really likes playing with this! He does need some help still, where he doeant really know all of his letters and isnt great at counting. On the words app, I take a few letters that look similar ie FTEL/CGOQ/BPD along with the letter that the game is asking for. show him which letter he needs, go over phonetic sound and say letter. Mix them up and ask him to find the letter he needs to play. He also likes tangegram making pictures with the shapes. We talk about what colors he needs for each step and how to line them up to make osmo happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Trick your kids into learning!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Bought for my soon to be 5 year old and her brother that's 8. I showed her how to play and she caught on within 5 minutes. And within 15 minutes she was already learning how to add and subtract to get numbers as big as 12! I even bought my son a switch for Christmas, but when she was playing he put it down to help her because it seemed more like a game than a learning tool! So cool!!!
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Woods

customer_reviews.title: Makes learning fun
customer_reviews.text: Our kids (ages 4 & 6) love it. Sometimes the camera takes a little longer to catch up but that could be the result of an impatient kiddo. Would definitely recommend this to someone.
customer_reviews.author: ExSci_guy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this gadget
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this gadget. We just opened for Christmas and we played the mind racer game (separate purchase) and it was fun but short lived. This one however comes with thinking games and my daughter (she's 6) did not want to stop the numbers game. Hopefully the rest of the set is just as fun.
customer_reviews.author: ikimaska

customer_reviews.title: We love Osmo
customer_reviews.text: We really like the OSMO- my son uses it and I also bring it to school for my 3rd grade classroom to use. I like that I can set up current spelling words or vocabulary for my son to practice on.
customer_reviews.author: Charfish

customer_reviews.title: Really cool invention
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves playing with this. It's a good way for them to learn to draw, since they copy what they see on the screen and it is a very ingenious creation to work with the I-Pad like it does. A much better use of the tablet that watching videos.
customer_reviews.author: GrimPhobos

customer_reviews.title: Good for big kids
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t hold the attention of any of my kids under age 9. If you want this for nine and up, wait until after Christmas. It goes on sale less than $30.
customer_reviews.author: Momofmany2019

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning time for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in Kindergarten. I bought this for her to play with to help inspire her learning and making it fun. After buying this I found out she actually uses it at school in her classroom. She has so much fun with it. She laughs and we do so many things. I also bought it for my niece for her birthday. I haven's given it to her yet.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Is this returnable.
customer_reviews.text: Not crazy about this product. It’s hardlyvused. Kids find it not user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Naomi lieberman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: 8 year old Granddaughter did not like as a Christmas gift
customer_reviews.author: GySgt

customer_reviews.title: We could not load the games and it works better on the ipad.
customer_reviews.text: We kept having to get passwords. The instructions wee not easy to find. Never did find it. How to get the games was really a hassle. it took us four days.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Ezaki

customer_reviews.title: Gift for grandson
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas and so far we have had hours of fun with it. Good educational and fun gift. My sister who is a teacher let my 4 year old grandson play with this when she visited and he had so much fun I bought it for him.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Grandsons and their friends love this. We gave it to them at Christmas and they didn't play with it immediately but now that the "dust has settled" they love it. We bought Osmo creative, also and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Polk

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old got this for Christmas and it’s easily her favorite gift so far. She’s playing with it constantly and gets upset when we tell her to take a break.
customer_reviews.author: mgreenfi

customer_reviews.title: Best educational game I have seen!!!
customer_reviews.text: One word “Awesome”!!!!! I have a four and six year old. They love playing this game system. It comes with 5 games, which the four year old can play 3/5 and the 6 year old can play 5/5. Tangram is awesome and is even fun for the adults. The masterpiece is great for budding artists. I loved this system and don’t feel bad about letting the kids get screen Tim!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Hitchner

customer_reviews.title: Best Christmas Gift of 2017!
customer_reviews.text: I was recommend this by a friend so we decided to make it part of Christmas. It has easily been the best gift of 2017. They’re still begging to play this daily. The monster, drawing and math ones are my kids favorite. I couldn’t be happier with this purchase. I’d give 12 stars if I could!! ❤️
customer_reviews.author: MForbush

customer_reviews.title: Our kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Our kids love this! It’s a lot of fun while also being educational. Could be a little cheaper but well worth what you pay for it!
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: 8 Year Old Grand Daughter Loves This
customer_reviews.text: I got it for her to keep her engaged with learning activities during the summer. It has done just that! Her Mom says she plays with it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Alaska Garden Girl

customer_reviews.title: Every Home should have one of these!
customer_reviews.text: Everything and more! I researched this before purchasing it is is more then I could have wished for. The grandchildren play and don’t even realize they are learning. A MUST HAVE!!! For children 3 and up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Wonderful Learning Product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who just turned four. He is already reading regular books, so thought he would get a lot of use out of it. He adores it and would use it all day if he was allowed to.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: EDUCATIONAL & FUN!
customer_reviews.text: This is a MUST for anyone that wants to help their children progress rapidly in school!! My son is 6 and LOVES LOVES this! he is always wanting to play this instead of video games!
customer_reviews.author: Millie

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent kit! Great word games and tangrams. My son (5) loves it. Easy to setup and simple to use with IPad.
customer_reviews.author: LL Ham

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit with iPad 3
customer_reviews.text: Unwrapped on Xmas tried to set up with iPad 3 didn’t fit below is product description of stating will fit with iPad 3 I will attempt contact with company to see if I can get a holder to fit iPad 3
customer_reviews.author: mandy

customer_reviews.title: Really cool toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my niece. She and her friends love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Pacco

customer_reviews.title: Fun and engaging
customer_reviews.text: I love this for my daughter. I use in my classroom as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to learn
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful way to get your child to learn without realizing it. Both my children learn completely different until this. Now they can play together and work on learning while playing.
customer_reviews.author: maressa

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this for my 5 year old son! But the excitement only lasts for dew days. The games get boring because its basically the same thing over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Soosoo

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS NOW
customer_reviews.text: We love the osmo genius kit! My 6 year old got this for Christmas and has been using it about everyday since! She is very competitive so she loves beating the little characters. When she doesn’t beta them on a certain challenge she lives that she can pick to do a rematch on the same challenge. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Condition description inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall product. However, the condition description on the one I got stated “Condition: Collectible - Very Good Used- Very Good Condition! - Item shows very little signs of use. Retail packaging is included and may be distressed. Item has been fully inspected, tested, cleaned and works great! All parts are included!” Unfortunately it IS missing a piece so all parts are NOT included! It is supposed to come with two of each number tile (0-9) yet it only has one number 4 tile.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Joy Druce

customer_reviews.title: Made well and fit perfect
customer_reviews.text: My son played with it for 3 days...and never touched it again. It is a good learning, but my son is an above average learner and I should have saved my money when he asked for this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Knowledge is always good
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is great for young children. I watched the excitement on my grandson's face when he saw it, then was amazed what he did with the various sections.
customer_reviews.author: Harry R. Heisler

customer_reviews.title: Great game but have to remove iPad from case
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves all the games. Even the 12 year old wants to play Newton and draw with Monsters. Totally worth the money except for one thing. You have to remove iPad from case, EERRR. I have been researching and they are just developed a, yes one case, that will work but you need to buy a case and a new base.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Cool...
customer_reviews.text: We had some pieces missing in the Tangrams or they disappeared right after we opened it....not sure which. Otherwise it’s very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Siano

customer_reviews.title: An interactive game that teaches children in a fun way to prepare for school
customer_reviews.text: To work with grandchildren in helping them prepare for school, develop reasoning and visual skills
customer_reviews.author: Marsha J. Hong

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: My 4 and 6 year olds love playing with their Osmo. Being able to interact with the games keeps their attention longer than just a iPad app does.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Great Stem Toy
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this toy with my 4 year old grandson. My son thinks this is a very good "toy", and takes great care to use it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: PeaHen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: For very young kids. Much lower than the age range advertised.

customer_reviews.title: really nice kit for kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: my kids really liked it and they can spend hours enjoying the different games. the way those games are interactive is enjoyable where adults will like it as well. Can fit any iPad size

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Toy for Kids and Adults!
customer_reviews.text: Usually, I am not interested in my son's toys, but Osmo is very fun to play so we take turns to try it! He told me that he likes to play Osmo better than Minecraft! I am happy to hear that!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia T

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: My kids love their Osmos. I brought one for my 4 year old and one for my 7 year old. My only complaint is that you can’t keep the iPad in a case while using it. My 4 year old drops everything and his iPad needs to stay in a case.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Educational Tool!
customer_reviews.text: What a buy! Very interactive, and my child loves it. Plays every day after school before any activity! Great tool to help learn some early skills!

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for learning!! Educational and fun for kids! My son spends hours on it! Loveee this!

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I adore this set. I use it in my classroom with 4-5 year olds, in my kids church program for K-5th graders and at home with my 5 and 7 year old. It’s just great.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product my two-year-old loves his other one and he’s getting this one for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Justin and Jenny Baggs

customer_reviews.title: Fun educational learning
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE Osmo! It’s so much fun for kids and adults to play together and kids alone. We can’t wait to get some of the additional “packs”. Great, fun, educational!

customer_reviews.title: Such an awesome concept
customer_reviews.text: This is by far one of my favorite things my daughter can do with her iPad. I love that it’s educational and fun for her!

customer_reviews.title: Osmo makes iPads more useful!
customer_reviews.text: My kid is having a great time with Osmo Genius! I will definitely recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my daughter for Christmas and love it! I live that it sends stuff to my phone so I know exactly how she is doing.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent use of technology for kids.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome program! Learning AND fun. Win win for kids and parents. I'm impressed. We use this for fun learning breaks during homeschool.

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy during primeday!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love playing games with their ipad. It is very educational and fun. Any child learning to count and problem solve, is a great!

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic learning game for children
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box my child loved it. Fantastic learning games for children.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!!!!!!!!!! My daughter loves it. She is 7 yrs old. Healthy activity for a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive learning game!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very impressed with this! My 8 & 7 year old love it. Very interactive, engaging and a quality learning product. Packaging is nice and makes it easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Ben & Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Just a guessing game.
customer_reviews.text: This product is okay. I don’t particular like the words app. I was hoping it would teach sight words, phonics or just had better categories. The game just makes a competition out of who can guess the missing letter of a word the fastest. Not really educational. The numbers app isn’t much different, just allows a lot of guessing.
customer_reviews.author: Danna M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: My cousin was not excited when he realized this was not another video game. But, he loves it now great for learning

customer_reviews.title: Super cool!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product for kids. The pictures they draw literally pop up on the screen. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: D. Maile Higgins

product_meta.title: Osmo - Genius Kit For Ipad - (Newer Version Available - Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Newer version available. Discontinued by manufacturer. Osmo learning games makes it fun for children to learn, using toys as teaching tools. Osmo is magic! In 2013, Osmo created a fun-filled & Award winning learning games that interact with actual hand held pieces & an iPad and/or fire tablet, bringing a child's game pieces & actions to life (no Wi-Fi necessary for game play). Osmo merges tactile exploration with innovative technology, actively engaging children in the learning process. Osmo games develop a wide range of skills, varying skills based on each game, including: creativity, problem-solving, confidence gaining, child-led, hands-on, gender-neutral, curriculum Inclusion, social/emotional skills, STEM/steam (science, technology, engineering Math & art) and many more educational capabilities. Games are designed for children between the ages of 3-D+ and include beginner to expert levels. Osmo enables the continuation of learning. Parents can track game progress, using child game profiles, on a parent app. Genius kit for iPad focuses on the following game play: shapes & placing in designs (tangram), problem solving/early physics (Newton), creative drawing skills (masterpiece), counting with numbers/dice (numbers), letters, spelling & vocabulary (words). approved by parents and teachers worldwide, used in over 30, 000 classrooms. Tag your photos on social media with #osmomagic to be featured!

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
feature_bullets: Newer version available. Discontinued by manufacturer. Osmo is magic: fun-filled & Award winning learning games that interact with actual hand held pieces & an iPad, bringing a child's game pieces & actions to life (no Wi-Fi necessary for game play).
Age & capability: ages 6-10+. games are designed for beginner to expert levels. Osmo enables the continuation of learning. Track game progress, using child game profiles, on a parent app.
What's in the box: Osmo base for iPad, Tangram pieces, numbers tiles, words tiles, stackable storage for each game, & 5 game apps: numbers, Tangram, words, Newton, and masterpiece.

Designed with fun & learning in mind, in Palo Alto, California. An iPad & Osmo base (iPad is not included) are required to play. Compatible with iPad 2-6, iPad mini 1-4, iPad Air 1-2, iPad Pro 9.7 & 10.5 inch. Fire tablet is not compatible with this base.
